title: Check In button enabled
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to a ballpark with a game scheduled
And it is within the 3 hour check in window
custom_expected:
Then the Check In button will be enabled on the Stadium if that Stadium has a game being played that day 

REPEAT for each Stadium

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the ballpark guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should see the check-in button on an enabled state(button should show the darkened black "Check in" text)
And the user should be able to tap it to navigate to the check-in form

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the check-in button Highlighted in light blue
And the user should be able to tap it to navigate to the check-in form

title: Check In button behaviour outside of the check in window
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected a Stadium with a game Scheduled
And we are outside the 3 hour check in window
custom_expected: Tapping on the button the user will be gated

custom_steps_separated.content: When we look at the Check In button on the ballpark guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the check-in text greyed out
And the button should throw the 3 hour message when its tapped

custom_steps_separated.content: When we look at the check-in button on the event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the check-in text greyed out
And the button should throw the 3 hour message when its tapped

title: Day|Night Double Headers are two seperate Check Ins
custom_preconds:
Given we have a Day / Night Doubleheader available at a Stadium 
And we have selected that Stadium that has a Day / Night Doubleheader

NOTE:  Please check with Mobile-QA on how to verify a Check In against the Server
custom_expected:
Then we are able to successfully Checkin to the game 
and it has it's own unique ID for that particular Check In

REPEAT for each part of the Doubleheader

custom_steps_separated.content: When we Check In to the first game of the split DH
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should only be checked-in for the first game only

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user check-in to the second game of the split DH
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should only be checked-in for the second game

title: Check In to West Coast game at 12:01 AM EST
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on a ballpark guide page
And is within the Check In window
And we have selected a Stadium that currently has a West Coast game in the state of in progress
And the time is currently 12:01 AM EST and/or greater
custom_expected: Then the user is able to Check In successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Check In button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be able to successfully make the check-in
And the user should see the check-in appear in the person's journal history on the day of the event

title: Event Detail flips once game goes final
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide page
And the game that was playing at this Stadium has just switched to a state of final
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the event detail section flip to the next available home game for that particular stadium
And tapping the check in button will gate the user

custom_steps_separated.content: When viewing the contents of the event detail section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the check-in button should be flipped to "view game wrap"
And the user should no longer be able to check-in to that game

title: Check-In flow - Ballpark Guide page
custom_preconds: Given we have selected a stadium
custom_expected: Then we are able to successfully Check In into that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we select a stadium
And the next event is outside 3 hour window
And we tap on the Check In button from the ballpark guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be thrown the 3 hour window

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we select a stadium
And the next event is within 3 hour window
And the user is outside the location check
And we tap on the Check In button from the ballpark guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the location check
And the user will see the message about the user being outside of the stadium

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we select a stadium
And the next event is within 3 hour window
And the user is within the location check
And we tap on the Check In button from the ballpark guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the check-in form
And the user will be able to complete the check-in

title: Check-In flow - Event Details
custom_preconds: Given we are on Event Details
custom_expected: Then we are able to successfully perform a Check In

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is outside the 3 hour window
And the user tap on the Check In button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will get the 3 hour window message
And the user will not be able to complete the check-in

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is within the 3 hour window
And the user is outside the the ballparks (2km or more)
And the user taps on the check-in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the location check
And the user will receive the message that they are outside the ballpark
And the user will not be able to complete the check-in

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is within the 3 hour window
and the user is within the ballpark check-in range
and the user taps on the check-in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the check-in form
and the user will be able to complete the check-in

title: Unlocking an Nth Offer
custom_preconds:
Given the game pk has an Nth offer associated with it
And the user checks into the game while meeting the Nth requirement (Nth offers are unlocked when the 'Nth' person checks into a specific game)
custom_steps:
When testing this case make sure create a new nth offer thru https://mmqacampaignmgr.bamnetworks.com/p/offers

The offer should be set to expire within the testing period to assure the offer unlocks and expires on time.
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the unlocked offer on the Checked In! page
And tapping on that offer will bring up a description

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user reaches the Checked In! page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will unlock the offer, and it will appear in the unlocked offer page on the journal

title: Unlocking a Total Check Ins Offer
custom_preconds:
Given that the stadium has a Total Required Check In offer associated with it
And the user has checked into a game & met that requirement
custom_steps:
create a new offer and make sure to set the expiration date within the testing period.

https://mmqacampaignmgr.bamnetworks.com/p/offers
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the unlocked offer on the Checked In! page
And tapping on that offer will bring up a description

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user reaches the Checked In! page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be see the total offer that he/she unlocked, and it will appear on the journal as soon as she navigates away from the checked-in page

title: Back to back double headers
custom_steps:
When there is a back to back doubleheader available
and we have selected the Stadium where the back to back doubleheader is being played
and attempts to Check In to the first game
custom_expected:
Then they are able to Check In successfully
And the user is also given credit for the second game of the doubleheader

title: User taps check in button with location services enabled, and is within 2km of ballpark
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services enabled 
And the user is located within 1.24mi of ballpark or has mocked location
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Check in page
And the Ballpark the user selected should appear as the selected location
And the user should be able to check in successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to a ballpark page
And the user taps the Check in button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the check-in form

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to complete check-in
and the user is within .9 miles of the ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to complete the check-in

title: User taps check in button with location services enabled, is located within 2km but is not immediately located
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services enabled 
And the user is located within 2km of ballpark or has mocked location
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the Map screen which should attempt to locate them
(Message: "Determining device location")
And when the user is finally located the maps screen should disappear
And the user should be taken to the Check in page
And the Ballpark the user selected should appear as the selected location
And the user should be able to check in successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to a ballpark page
And the user taps the Check in button
And the user's location is not cached or cannot be determined immediately
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be blocked from completing check-in
and the user will receive a message on the check-in form that informs the user they were not able to confirm your location.

title: User taps check in button with location services enabled, is not located near ballpark
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services enabled 
And the user is NOT located within 2km of ballpark
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Maps screen (location error screen)
And the user's location should be shown in relation to the Ballpark they are trying to check in to.
And the user should see a message indicating that they don't appear to be At the Ballpark
(Message: "Your device thinks you're not at Yankee Stadium. You must be at the ballpark to check in. Tap refresh to try again.

If you continue to have problems, view the Help")

And there should be a 'refresh' button present on the screen.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to a ballpark page
And the user taps the Check in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be directed to the location check
And the user will be notified that the device is not located near the ballpark
and the user will not be able to complete the check-in

title: User taps check in button with location services NOT enabled
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services DISABLED
And has navigated to a ballpark page with its check in window open
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Maps screen
And the user should see an error informing the user that they must enable location services to use At the Ballpark. 
(Message: "Location services must be enabled to check in. Go to your Settings app to turn on location services for the At the Ballpark app.")
And there should be a 'Enable a location service' button that takes user directly to their settings > location service

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Check in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the location services check
And the user will be notified to enable location services on that specific device

title: User taps refresh on location error screen
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services enabled and is not near the ballpark
Or the user has location services NOT enabled
And the user has navigated to a ballpark with its check in window open
And the user has tapped on the Check In button
custom_expected: Then the user's location should attempt to be refreshed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is brought to the Location error screen
When the user taps the 'refresh' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be directed to the location check
And the user will receive a notification informing the user that either the device is not located near the ballpark OR the location services is not enabled

title: User taps check in button with location services enabled, is not located near ballpark but is not immediately located
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services enabled 
And the user is NOT located within 2km of ballpark
And the user's location is not cached or cannot be determined immediately
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the Map screen which should attempt to locate them
(Message: "Determining device location")
And when the user is finally located they should remain on the Maps screen
And the user should be informed that their location has determined that they are not near the ballpark they are trying to check in to.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to a ballpark page
And the user taps the Check in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the location service check
and the user will be notified the device is not located at the specific ballpark
and the user will not be able to complete check-in

title: User receives location services error, turns on location services, attempts to check in.
custom_preconds:
Given the user has location services DISABLED
And the user navigates to a Ballpark page with its check in window open
And the user taps the Check In button
And the user sees the Location error screen 
And the user turns on location services
And navigates back to the Maps screen
custom_expected:
Then the user's location should be refreshed
And when the user is finally located the maps screen should disappear
And the user should be taken to the Check in page
And the Ballpark the user selected should appear as the selected location
And the user should be able to successfully check in

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'refresh' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will either move to the check-in form or the user will be brought to the location check
And the location check will notify the user they are not near the balpark
and the user will not be able to complete check-in

title: Check In button still enabled when not near stadium
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide page
And the Stadium has a game being played at it today
And the user is within the 3 hour window
custom_expected: Then the Check In button will be visible for the user

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the users location is not near the Stadium
and the user is on the event detail view or the BPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the check-in button enabled on both the event detail and BPG

title: Check In button enabled for Delayed Start
custom_preconds: Given we have selected a Stadium with a game inside of the Check In window
custom_expected:
Then the Check In button is still visible to the user
And the user is able to perform a Check In

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game state is set to a state of Delayed Start
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the check-in button will be enabled on both event detail and bpg

title: Check In button enabled in Delayed state
custom_preconds: Given we have selected a Stadium with a game inside of the Check In window
custom_expected:
Then the Check In button is still visible to the user
And the user is able to perform a successful Check In

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game state is set to Delay
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the check-in button will be enabled on both the event detail and bpg

title: Facebook first time permissions
custom_preconds:
Given we haven't logged into Facebook inside of the application before
and we have selected a Stadium our device believes we are at
and the checkin button is enabled
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the permissions page
And an Okay button to allow the app to post on the user's behalf

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Checkin button
And the user has enabled the Facebook switch
And the user has logged into Facebook for the first time
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the facebook button enabled on the check-in formm

title: Confirm Check In on Facebook after accepting
custom_preconds:
Given the user has just logged into Facebook for the first time
and the user has selected "Allow" on the permissions box
and the user has completed the Check In process
custom_expected: Then we will see a post on Facebook for that particular check in

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views that Facebook user's wall
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the facebook post with the checkin detail

title: Facebook credentials should cache
custom_preconds:
Given the user has previously logged into Facebook through the application
And the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected:
Then the Facebook icon switches to enabled
And no Facebook Login page appears

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the share icon for Facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the facebook button will be enabled
and the check-in will be posted to facebook when it is completed

title: Check In Page header
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected: Then the user will see 'Check In' in the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the back button at the top of the page
and the user will see the check-in text

title: Check In Page > back button
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected:
Then the Check In page will close
And the user will be returned to their previous page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the back button in top left
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be brought to the page they navigated from

title: Check In Page Event Information
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the date of the event (format: Saturday, Sept 29)
And the event start time will be to the right of the date (format: 12:05 p.m.)
And the venue name will appear in larger bold text

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content loads
And the user looks directly below the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the event time and date along with the ballpark name
and below the image and text field the user will see the 2 team match ups

title: Twitter switch enabled posts to Twitter
custom_preconds:
Given we have set our device near a Stadium of a game we want to Checkin to
And the user is on the ballpark guide page
And there is game in that stadium on that day

URL: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Stadium+Longitude-Latitude
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to Checkin successfully
And the Checkin posts to Twitter

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to Checkin
And the user has enabled the Twitter switch
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will make a post to twitter
and the check-in will also end up on the history

title: Facebook switch enabled posts to Facebook
custom_preconds:
Given we have set our device near a Stadium of a game we want to Checkin to
And the user is on the ballpark guide page
And there is game in that stadium on that day

URL: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Stadium+Longitude-Latitude
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to Checkin successfully
And the Checkin posts to Facebook as: "Checked in @ (ballpark) for the #team vs #team game w/ MLB.com"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to Checkin
And the user has enabled the Facebook switch
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be able to check-in
and the check-in text and photo will appear on facebook along with the users journal history

title: Facebook switch is enabled
custom_preconds:
Given we have set our device near a Stadium of a game we want to Checkin to
And the user is on the ballpark guide page
And there is game in that stadium on that day

URL: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Stadium+Longitude-Latitude
custom_expected: Then the user is able to Checkin successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to Checkin
And the user has enabled the Facebook switch.
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should see the check-in posted on facebook, and the journal history

title: Facebook and Twitter switches are enabled
custom_preconds:
Given we have set our device near a Stadium of a game we want to Checkin to
And the user is on the ballpark guide page
And there is game in that stadium on that day

URL: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/Stadium+Longitude-Latitude
custom_expected: Then the user is able to Checkin successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to Checkin
And the user has enabled the Facebook switch
And the user has enabled the Twitter switch
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will post to both facebook and twitter
and the user will see the check-in under the journal history

title: Check In Page add a photo
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Choose Image menu with Camera or Photo Library

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the camera icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be prompted options to either add an existing photo or take a new photo

title: Check In Page matchup information
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected: Then the user will see the game's matchup (format: away team vs. home team)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks above the optional free text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the match up information and the home team will located to the right side

title: Check In Page seating info
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Check In page
And the user fills in data for the Section, Row, and Seat field
custom_expected:
Then we are able to see the Section area stored on the server
And we are able to see the Row area stored on the server
And we are able to see the Seat area stored on the server

_Check on server: obtain identity point (oracle tool) > access the file attached to this case > enter ID Point into the "Check In History" tap submit_

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user completes the Check In successfully
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user's section,row, and seat will be saved on the check-in history

title: Check In Page sharing options
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see icons for facebook, and twitter,
And tapping on these icons will enable/disable each sharing option

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Sharing section
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see options to enable facebook, and twitter

title: Check In buttons
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Check In page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a Check In button
And tapping this button will complete a Check In 
And the user will be brought to the Checked In! confirmation page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the bottom of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the check-in button

title: Checked In! back button
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Checked In! page
custom_expected: Then the user will be returned to the ballpark guide of the home team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be brought back to the event detail or the bpg depending on where they navigated from

title: Checked In! welcome message
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Checked In! page
custom_expected: They will see a message stating 'Welcome To: 'Ballpark Name''

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the header
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see the welcome message appear on the checked-in page

title: Checked In! matchup information
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Checked In! page
custom_expected: Then the user will see the matchup info (format: away vs. home)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the welcome message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the match up information
And the home team will always be located to the right side

title: Checked In! unlocked offers
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Checked In! page
And the user has unlocked an offer(s)
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a list of offers the user has unlocked
And tapping one of those offers will bring the user to the offer page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the matchup info
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a cell for each offer he/she unlocked
And the user will be able to tap on each cell to go into an internal webview about said offer
And the user will be able to see when the offer expires and when it was unlocked

title: Checked in state
custom_preconds:
Given The user is on the ballpark guide or the event detail view
And the user wants to check-in to a game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user checks in to a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should see on the ballpark guide the following:
- the check-in icon will be greyed out with the text "checked-in"

And the user should see on that specific event the following:
- the check-in link will be greyed out with the text "checked-in"
